dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ciudad Real airport, built to handle overflow from Madrid, was a staggering 160 miles north of the city.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ciudad Real airport, built to handle overflow from Madrid, was a staggering one hundred sixty miles north of the city.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Originally designed to take excess traffic away from Madrid Barajas airport, the airfield was located a staggering 150 miles North of the city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and that remote location was a huge problem. Low-cost airlines prefer secondary airports, but that was just too far for passengers to absorb.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and that remote location was a huge problem. Low-cost airlines prefer secondary airports, but that was just too far for passengers to absorb.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At a time when low-cost airlines were keeping costs down by serving secondary airports, the remote location of Ciudad Real seemed a little too much for passengers and airlines alike to absorb.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It only operated for four years, with just two airlines—Ryanair and EasyJet. The government even had to subsidize some of those flights.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It only operated for four years, with just two airlines-Ryanair and EasyJet. The government even had to subsidize some of those flights.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The international airport was open for just three years and saw flights from only two airlinesRyanair and Vueling, with the latter having its flights subsidised by the government.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then it just sat there, abandoned. They had to paint huge yellow crosses on the runway so pilots knew not to land there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then it just sat there, abandoned. They had to paint huge yellow crosses on the runway so pilots knew not to land there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the abandoned airport still racking up costs as it fell into disrepairincluding having to paint large yellow crosses over the crumbling runway so pilots knew the airfield was abandoned, the airport was finally put up for sale.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it became this white elephant, racking up maintenance costs. They tried to sell it for 90 million euros initially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it became this white elephant, racking up maintenance costs. They tried to sell it for ninety million euros initially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With an initial price tag of 80 million being shunned, that airport was eventually picked up in July 2015 by Tzaneen International, a group of British and Asian investors, for just 10,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But nobody wanted it at that price. Eventually, a group called Tzaneen Global Investments bought it for just 12,000 euros in 2015.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But nobody wanted it at that price. Eventually, a group called Tzaneen Global Investments bought it for just twelve thousand euros in twenty fifteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With an initial price tag of 80 million being shunned, that airport was eventually picked up in July 2015 by Tzaneen International, a group of British and Asian investors, for just 10,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's an insane drop in price. They planned to invest up to 110 million, thinking Chinese companies might use it as their European hub.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's an insane drop in price. They planned to invest up to one hundred ten million, thinking Chinese companies might use it as their European hub.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm said in a statement that it planned to invest between 60 to 100 million into regenerating the airfield on the basis that several Chinese companies are interested in making it into their main point of entry into Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the court rejected that sale, saying the bid was too low and didn't include the terminal or car parks. So that deal fell through.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the court rejected that sale, saying the bid was too low and didn't include the terminal or car parks. So that deal fell through.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, Spains commercial court rejected the bid saying that it was too low and that the airport terminal and car parks wouldnt have been included.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Later, another bid for 30 million also collapsed. It wasn't until 2018 that it finally sold for 58 million euros.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Later, another bid for thirty million also collapsed. It wasn't until twenty eighteen that it finally sold for fifty eight million euros.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Later that year, an unidentified investor proposed a 28 million bid for the airfield to the courts, however, that potential transaction also fell through. Three years later the airport was eventually sold for 56.2 million to Ciudad Real International Airport SL in September 2018, and the previously abandoned airport received its first flight last monthironically with no passengers on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then last month, a 747 landed there—but with no passengers on board. Just symbolic, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then last month, a seven hundred forty seven landed there-but with no passengers on board. Just symbolic, really.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Three years later the airport was eventually sold for 56.2 million to Ciudad Real International Airport SL in September 2018, and the previously abandoned airport received its first flight last monthironically with no passengers on. A 747 landed at the airstrip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Now they're trying to rebrand it as a tech support and flight training center, since calling it 'Madrid Airport North' was… optimistic, given it's 160 miles away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Now they're trying to rebrand it as a tech support and flight training center, since calling it 'Madrid Airport North' was... optimistic, given it's one hundred sixty miles away.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The last few years have yet again seen the ghost airport change ownership, with an attempt to rebrand the airfield as Madrid Airport South being halted, likely since Madrid is 150 miles away. With owners now looking to rebrand the space into offering tech support, maintenance and flight training, it seems as though it may still be quite some time before we see passenger arrivals at Ciudad Real airport.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And with Madrid possibly building a new second airport just 25 miles out, who's gonna choose Ciudad Real for a short-haul flight?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And with Madrid possibly building a new second airport just twenty five miles out, who's gonna choose Ciudad Real for a short-haul flight?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfortunately, though, there is the increasing prospect of Madrid getting a brand new second airport, just over 20 miles from the city in Casarrubios del Monte.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, the dry environment is good for aircraft storage. Some firms are interested in that, at least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, the dry environment is good for aircraft storage. Some firms are interested in that, at least.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With several firms looking to invest in the airfield, there is still a lifeline for this once abandoned facility, who have left their doors open for commercial traffic along with the alternative aviation activities they have proposed, which includes aircraft storage in the dry desert-like environment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the big question is whether passengers will ever actually use it again. Time will tell, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the big question is whether passengers will ever actually use it again. Time will tell, I guess.
